skills.label: Implement multithreading and asynchronous processing
items: Use the task parallel library, including theparallel.for method, plinq, tasks
Manage data by using concurrent collections

skills.label: Manage multithreading
items: Implement thread-safe methods to handle race conditions

skills.label: Implement program flow
items: Iterate across collection and array items
Program decisions by using switch statements, if/then, and operators

skills.label: Create and implement events and callbacks
items: Subscribe to and unsubscribe from events
Use built-in delegate types to create events

skills.label: Implement exception handling
items: Handle exception types, including sql exceptions, network exceptions, communication exceptions, network timeout exceptions
Use base class of an exception

skills.label: Create types
items: Create value types, including structs and enum
Create reference types, generic types, constructors, static variables, methods, classes, extension methods

skills.label: Consume types
items: Box or unbox to convert between value types
Ensure interoperability with code that accesses com apis

skills.label: Enforce encapsulation
items: Enforce encapsulation by using accessors, including public, private, protected, and internal
Enforce encapsulation by using explicit interface implementation

skills.label: Create and implement a class hierarchy
items: Create and implement classes based on the icomparable, ienumerable, idisposable, and iunknown interfaces

skills.label: Find, execute, and create types at runtime by using reflection
items: Generate code at runtime by using codedom and lambda expressions
Use types from the system.reflection namespace, including assembly, propertyinfo, methodinfo, type

skills.label: Manage the object life cycle
items: Implement idisposable, including interaction with finalization
Manage idisposable by using the using statement

skills.label: Manipulate strings
items: Manipulate strings by using the stringbuilder, stringwriter, and stringreader classes

skills.label: Validate application input
items: Choose the appropriate data collection type
Evaluate a regular expression to validate the input format
Use built-in functions to validate data type and content

skills.label: Manage assemblies
items: Put an assembly in the global assembly cache

skills.label: Perform I/O operations
items: Read and write files and streams
Read and write from the network by using classes in the system.net namespace

skills.label: Consume data
items: Retrieve data by using web services

skills.label: Query and manipulate data and objects by using LINQ
items: Query data by using operators, including projection, join, group, take, skip, aggregate
Query data by using query comprehension syntax
Select data by using anonymous types
Read, filter, create, and modify data structures by using linq to xml

skills.label: Serialize and deserialize data
items: Serialize and deserialize data by using binary serialization, custom serialization, xml serializer, json serializer, and data contract serializer

skills.label: Store data in and retrieve data from collections
items: Store and retrieve data by using dictionaries, arrays, lists, sets, and queues
Add and remove items from a collection
